com.cisco.onep.tutorials

Class BaseTutorial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cisco.onep.tutorials.BaseTutorial

  • public class BaseTutorial
extends java.lang.Object
    The goal of the BaseTutorial is to show how to create an application and connect to a network element to obtain a session handle. The BaseTutorial provides base class functions for reading test properties, parsing command line properties, and network element connectivity.
    Author:
    The onePK Team (onepk-feedback@cisco.com)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Invokes the tutorial via the command line.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String applicationName)
                throws com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException
        Obtains a NetworkApplication instance, sets the name to applicationName, gets a network element for the IP address in the command line arguments or tutorial.properties file - both via the string format and an InetAddress formed from the IP address string - and then tries to connect to the Network Element with the username and password supplied, or from the tutorial.properties file.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - The NetworkApplication name is set to this value.
        Returns:
        True if the connection succeeded without exception, else false.
        Throws:
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException - If there is an error.

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
        Disconnects the application from the Network Element.
        Returns:
        True if the disconnect succeeded without an exception, else false if the application failed to disconnect from the Network Element.

      • getElementAddr

        public java.lang.String getElementAddr()
        Gets the IP address or hostname of the Network Element set during instantiation.
        Returns:

      • getElementInetAddress

        public java.net.InetAddress getElementInetAddress()
                                           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Gets the elementAddr, the Network Element's address or hostname, as an InetAddress.
        Returns:
        The elementAddr as an InetAddress.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the NetworkElement cannot be resolved to a host.

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()

        Returns:
        The username that is specified via the command line or in the tutorial.properties file.

        Returns:
        The password that is specified via the command line or in the tutorial.properties file.

      • simulateShutdown

        public void simulateShutdown(boolean state)
                      throws com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException,
                             java.net.UnknownHostException
        This method changes the status, i.e. shuts down or brings up, of all interfaces for the NetworkElement the NetworkApplication is connected to, except the interface that the NetworkApplication itself is connected to.

        The method will first check to see if the interface address matches the interface that the NetworkApplication is connected to. If it matches then the interface will not be acted upon. Otherwise shutdown(state) is call on the NetworkInterface.

        Call simulateShutdown(false) to turn ON all of the interfaces or simulateShutdown(true) to turn OFF all of the interfaces (except the interface the NetworkApplication is connected to, of course).

        Parameters:
        state - Interface goes down if state = true, or up if state = false.
        Throws:
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException - When there is an error.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the NetworkElement cannot be resolved.

      • getInterface

        public com.cisco.onep.interfaces.NetworkInterface getInterface()
                                                        throws com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException,
                                                               com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepRemoteProcedureException,
                                                               com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepConnectionException,
                                                               java.net.UnknownHostException
        Returns the first interface from the interface list.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepRemoteProcedureException
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepConnectionException
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • parseOptions

        public void parseOptions(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parse options from the command line arguments, or if none are supplied, from the properties file "tutorial.properties". If any required options are missing, the application will exit.
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments passed to the main(...) method.
